column4: anyone know how to configure tbird so that it leaves all mail on the google servers but when you read and delete messages it does these actions for you on the server?
use IMAP
essentially thunderbird will act like a frontend to your gmail account
you should be able to set them all up in thunderbird, under seperate accounts
if you just want to use one mail program thunderbird is the ideal solution
as long as all the mail you want to check supports pop or IMAP
i dont think hotmail and Y!mail do that's why i was advised to use those
i can't advise what to use for hotmail or yahoo since i use neither, but IMAP is the way to go w/ thunderbird
you could forward your yahoo and hotmail to gmail and then set up gmail on thunderbird using IMAP
hmm but even if i setup that as imap they'll still be in the original accounts also right? plus do the sender details get changed?
you'll know who sent them and they will stay in their original accounts, but as Ienorand said apparently hotmail doesn't forward mail out
so is there no way around it for hotmail?
why would you want to forward it back to the account of origin?  it'll still be there anyway
oh, i thought you forwarded the message itself, not a copy
it's a copy.  if there is no way to forward hotmail and it doesn't have POP or IMAP access, frankly, i'd just stop using hotmail
unfortunately i can't do that easily, its my oldest and most used account
does hotmail allow you to set an away message?
not sure, why?
because if it does and you're worried about people not being able to reach you you can just set an away msg with a different email address
its more to do with newsletters, and contact details i've left, i wouldn't want to leave it anyway, i'd rather just use it online
it sounds like you're going to be using more than one program or accessing via http
well if webmail works as Ienorand says it should be fine with tbird
